funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.io

Class WaveWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.io.WaveWriter

  • public class WaveWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to write audio data to a Wave (.wav) file according to the format described here.
    See Also:
    WaveFormat, MSWAVEInputStream

    • Constructor Summary

      Construct a new WaveWriter from a file name and WaveFormat

        public WaveWriter(java.lang.String waveFileName,
                  WaveFormat format)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Construct a new WaveWriter from a file name and WaveFormat
        Parameters:
        waveFileName - the name of the resulting .wav file (including the path)
        format - the format of audio to be written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs when opening the file

                  WaveFormat format)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Construct a new WaveWriter from a File and WaveFormat
        Parameters:
        waveFile - the File to write data to
        format - the format of audio to be written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs when opening the file

      • WaveWriter

        public WaveWriter(java.io.File waveFile,
                  int numChannels,
                  int sampleRate,
                  int bitsPerSample)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Construct a new WaveWriter from a File and the audio format parameters
        Parameters:
        waveFile - the File to write data to
        numChannels - the number of channels in the audio
        sampleRate - the sample rate (Hz) of the audio
        bitsPerSample - how many bits to use to store each sample
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs when opening the file
